description: Manage VMs in an azure devtest lab.

commands.name: az lab vm apply-artifacts
commands.summary: Apply artifacts to virtual machine. This operation can take a while to complete.
commands.syntax:
az lab vm apply-artifacts --lab-name
                          --name
                          --resource-group
                          [--artifacts]
                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az lab vm apply-artifacts --artifacts artifacts.json --lab-name MyLab --name MyVirtualMachine --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az lab vm claim
commands.summary: Command to claim a VM in the Azure DevTest Lab.

commands.name: az lab vm create
commands.summary: Create a VM in a lab.
commands.syntax:
az lab vm create --lab-name
                 --name
                 --resource-group
                 [--admin-password]
                 [--admin-username]
                 [--allow-claim {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                 [--artifacts]
                 [--authentication-type {password, ssh}]
                 [--disk-type {Premium, Standard, StandardSSD}]
                 [--expiration-date]
                 [--formula]
                 [--generate-ssh-keys {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                 [--image]
                 [--image-type {custom, gallery}]
                 [--ip-configuration {private, public, shared}]
                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                 [--notes]
                 [--saved-secret]
                 [--size]
                 [--ssh-key]
                 [--subnet]
                 [--tags]
                 [--vnet-name]

commands.name: az lab vm delete
commands.summary: Delete virtual machine. This operation can take a while to complete.
commands.syntax:
az lab vm delete --lab-name
                 --name
                 --resource-group
                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                 [--yes]

commands.name: az lab vm hibernate
commands.summary: Hibernate a virtual machine This operation can take a while to complete.
commands.syntax:
az lab vm hibernate --lab-name
                    --name
                    --resource-group
                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az lab vm hibernate --resource-group MyResourceGroup --lab-name MyLab --name MyVM

commands.name: az lab vm list
commands.summary: List virtual machines in a given lab.
commands.syntax:
az lab vm list --lab-name
               --resource-group
               [--all {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
               [--claimable {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
               [--environment]
               [--expand]
               [--filters]
               [--max-items]
               [--next-token]
               [--object-id]
               [--order-by]
               [--top]
examples: az lab vm list --lab-name MyLab --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az lab vm start
commands.summary: Start a virtual machine. This operation can take a while to complete.
commands.syntax:
az lab vm start --lab-name
                --name
                --resource-group
                [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]

commands.name: az lab vm stop
commands.summary: Stop a virtual machine This operation can take a while to complete.
commands.syntax:
az lab vm stop --lab-name
               --name
               --resource-group
               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]

commands.name: az lab vm wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
